intro: Philagonia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Philagonia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
